intro: Capsella mexicana, commonly known as Mexican catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer, followed by pods that contain seeds. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in open fields and along roadsides. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a hairy texture, and it is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
